intro: Thamnochortus scabridus, commonly known as the scabrous broom, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its dense, shrub-like growth habit. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in spherical heads, typical of the daisy family. Its leaves are typically scabrous, or rough to the touch, giving it its common name. Thamnochortus scabridus is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient species in its native range.
